administrative.name: Metal Amended Liquid Sludge Experiment
administrative.description:
Enables the comparison of metal concentrations (zinc, copper and cadmium) at 3 rates in small amounts of organic matter applied as a specially made liquid sludge applied. 
Samples of the sludge used and periodic soil and plant samples are available in the Rothamsted Sample Archive. 
This experiment is part of a network of 3 sites across the UK and can also be compared with related Contaminated Sludge Cake Experiment and Metal Salts Experiment, also at Woburn.
administrative.disambiguatingDescription: To the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium on soil microbial activity with low organic matter inputs.

dataAccess.conditionsOfAccess: Available to any researcher on request
dataAccess.actionableFeedbackPolicy: To the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium on soil microbial activity with low organic matter inputs.
dataAccess.correctionsPolicy: To the effects of zinc, copper and cadmium on soil microbial activity with low organic matter inputs.

citation.citation: Gibbs, P. A. , Chambers, B. J. , Chaudri, A. M. , McGrath, S. P. and Carlton-Smith, C. H. (2006) "Initial results from long-term field studies at three sites on the effects of heavy metal-amended liquid sludges on soil microbial activity", Soil Use and Management, 22, 180-187

Chaudri, A. , McGrath, S. , Gibbs, P. , Chambers, B. , Carlton-Smith, C. , Bacon, J. , Campbell, C. and Aitken, M. (2008) "Population size of indigenous Rhizobium leguminosarum biovar trifolii in long-term field experiments with sewage sludge cake, metal-amended liquid sludge or metal salts: Effects of zinc, copper and cadmium", Soil Biology & Biochemistry, 40, 1670-1680
